DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether differences in the gene coding for the liver enzyme carboxylesterase 1 (CES1) means differences in the metabolism of methylphenidate, a CES1 dependent drug.
DOC.brief_title: Impact of CES1 Genotype on Metabolism of Methylphenidate
DOC.criteria: > 18 years old Caucasian Chronic disease (except hay fever and eczema) Pregnancy Smoking High level of alcohol consumption (> 21 units per week for men and 14 for women) Known allergy towards methylphenidate Permanent use of medication (contraception ok)
